posts.body:
>>ba559eaa-d3c9-4ad7-8afe-dca0c461f208
This site is strictly an improvement on whatever other chan.  

And you can post privately over tor without worrying about your ISP or a VPN logging what you do or tying it to your id. 

I can't ATM imagine why this isn't the futre of chans.

>>89ce5dda-2fa8-46c6-a7b8-6af2f14d3de3
And the barrier to entry is going to mean it's the best of us.

>>474eac54-7e32-4e44-8cb2-dda0ab9ec320
You're mentally retarded if you connect to vpn to then connect to tor.   The vpn will act like an ISP which defeats the purpose of the VPN. 

The ONLY reason to use a VPN and TOR would be if you want to connect to something that doesn't allow tor exit nodes to connect.  Then you would use TOR to connect to the VPN and the VPN to connect to the site.   You would need to use anonymous means and tor to sign up for the VPN or it would compromise you.

So maybe you buy a giftcard with cash, or run you own bitcoin node over tor and pay fo the vpn using that.  

(I hope you bought your bitcoin with cash at a bitcoin ATM )

But I am thinking this is quickly going to become moot.   Why connect to shit that doesn't allow tor?  Just hang out where you can use tor/i2p/etc.  Let the corporate net die on the vine.

>>ace11540-3679-4054-aac6-1b61e9f0c27e
Makes sense to me.  Someone probably skimmed other manifestos for points they wanted to smear then posted it to get 8ch shutdown.  

This place is better than other chans though because you can post images over tor ( set yourself up a firewalled user that can only communicate over tor and use regular browser till torbrowser image posting is fixed).   Can't see any disadvantages.  Shutting down 8ch really backfired.

>>0dc5c3cc-252d-41d8-8fd6-676bda9377b2
Just imagine if there wasn't.  I'd rather have one than have it spamming up here.

>>d0f2c4c9-64ca-4f8c-95d8-9af450ed97d6
Didn't even notice it till you pointed it out.

posts.subject: Tor werks gud
posts.body:
>>5b78df93-2d18-4da9-8f15-cf120bac28ee
Anyway, I'm posting this image over tor right now ( not with tor-browser )

But I've got both the zeronet unix user and the anonymous user I use for everything on this computer firewalled so they cannot access the net except through tor.  I have no personally idenifiable info on this machine.  Even my memes were all downloaded via tor

>>c3ea06d1-5d86-4f2c-b5b1-c110f203675f
I am legitimately confused:

1) Why did they have the wrong picture before?

2) Why does his dad resemble the first pic?

I am going to build this to have whonix level safety on a shitty old machine.  With this, even if NSA hacks my computer with javascript and completely roots my machine, they still can't know who I am.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Build_Documentation/Physical_Isolation

>>a1e4f73f-1350-4ca6-9923-314f99f90c35
If image is posted  image posting with tor stil works

>>62ba1ea1-ea7e-46c8-9031-d70075a6dcf7
I posted this using anon user running regular browser ( not tor browser )


Here is my torrc
https://pastebin.pl/view/1342947c

Here is my iptables firewall config.

https://pastebin.pl/view/b9fbacb4

zeronet was installed into a python virtual environment and the process runs as zeronet user.

zeronet user is in the tor group so it can read the tor control cookie.


I always log in as anon.   Anon is barred from accessing the net except via tor by firewall.  All attempts to access regular net are redirected through tor via trans-proxy.

This is in effect for both anon ( where I am logged in ) and for zeronet process running under the zeronet user.


This means that even if my browser were hacked it would be running as anon which cannot access the net except by tor.


Very convenient. ( but if they  were to hack to the point where they could run a process not using anon user or zeronet user I'd still be hosed.  Not perfect but good enough if you're not doing anything illegal )  

Next level up in security would be to build this:
 
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Build_Documentation/Physical_Isolation

( or just have a very beefy machine and run whonix / qubes )

I have a shitty old machine so I'm going for raspberrry pi physical isolation as my next spare time project.

The nice thing about the firewall tor config and the physical isolation config is that you don't need to configure zeronet at all.  It tries to connect normally, but it gets automatically redirected to tor by the firewall.

But you can then afterwards configure zeronet for tor in case there are performance enhancements tailored to tor.  (but even if you screw up zeronet config for tor, your firewall or physical isolation still saves your ass )

Also links off from zeronet sites are redirected to tor by firewall if browsing with anon user, so  THEY can't compromize you.

Can use dissenter, or even twitter too.

And you can run tor-browser under this setup for higher security needs.  This setup is the base setup that by default torrifies everything.  Having tor be the default trains you to use tor friendly sites, and protects you from casual logging - remember, logs are forever.  If Joseph Stalin gets into power he'll comb through all the logs that were kept from the days when that shit was legal.  A total asshole can make things retroactively illegal.

>>5e547fbb-86a2-4e3d-adef-145afa283168
Twatter does allow tor posting. 

To be anonymous you need to buy a burner phone.

The first time you use it, do so from a laptop using donut shop wifi.  When twatter calls you to verify enter the code.

Thereafter you can log in with out your burner phone over tor.

You need to only use your burner phone away from home ( and have bought it with cash ) and take the battery out before your return home.  This whole escapade is best done on a business trip across ountry.

>>86a5297f-7011-47b7-adc3-417ebbe9f5ce
I think this is a thing that would warrant massive protests.  If they passed this, then it would be time to hit the streets.  We'd all be nazis but we'd be protesting for 1A.   Its stated goals could encompass all tech censorship.  Nobody would be ashamed to show up for such a protest.  

If Trump were to sign this bill I would join the Dem party unironically vote for the most libtarded liberal to help hasten the start of Civil War II.  If people live under such tyranny for long, they get used to it and forget how to break out.   People would need to stand up while they remember how.

I don't see any zero menu on the right.
